titlestmt.titleproper: BU Records: Emmy Parrish Lectures in American Studies Series, Inclusive: 1990-1996

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.unittitle: BU Records: Emmy Parrish Lectures in American Studies Series
did.abstract: BU Records: Emmy Parrish Lectures in American Studies Series contains materials relating to the speakers of past lectures, including correspondence and programs.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Emmy Parrish Lecture Series is a semi-annual lecture in American Studies, hosted by Baylor University’s history department and was established in 1991 in honor of Frances “Emmy” Parrish. Emmy’s husband, Tom Z. Parrish established the lecture series to honor her efforts in the Waco community. Emmy was a public-school teacher in Waco for over 20 years and a Baylor Trip Camp counselor. The Emmy Parrish Lecture Series continues today and has covered everything from the history of jazz music to the American Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection begins in 1990 and ends in 1996. The collection primarily deals with guest speakers for the lecture and materials relating to planning of the event, including correspondence. There are also biographies of the speakers, copies of the speakers' lectures, and programs from the lectures.
Some materials in the collection were compiled by previous Texas Collection staff members over time and kept in subject files. These materials were added to the collection during processing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, the collection was arranged in unlabeled folders in no particular order. Currently, the collection is arranged in one series: I. Speakers. Within the series, folders are arranged chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BU Records: Emmy Parrish Lectures in American Studies Series, Accession #BU/326, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Leanna Barcelona. Released on 2020-03-24.

bibref.extref: Hardage, Rebekah. "Emmy Parrish Lecture in American Studies to feature Civil War Historian." Baylor University. 2008 February 27. Accessed 2019 December 3.
"Parrish, Thomas Z." Waco Tribune-Herald. 2018 January 18. Accessed 2019 December 3.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains materials relating to invited lecture speakers, such as correspondence, copies of lectures, and programs. This series is in good condition.
